page.title: 08Ecology.
page.content: The elm trees in the park have had to be cut down because of Dutch Elm disease, which has been rife for some years now. There is no cure at the moment, so many trees have been lost. The Park Warden told us there was a danger that England would lose all its Elm trees. The Cheetham family owned many cotton mills. They planted most of the trees in the park. The Yew trees are the oldest. The house that the Cheethams lived in, was pulled down 30 years ago. The most famous mill built by the Cheethams is called Bankwood Mill. The park is built on a very steep piece of land. It is mainly natural, but is now having some formal lawns and flowers introduced. The latest part is an adventure playpark, built for the younger children of the neighbourhood.
